comments.body: I'm a little surprised that 30 collections takes 6 minutes to test. I'm going to LGTM this to get the running time down, but maybe you can look into seeing why it is slow?
30 collections is creating 120 rc and 480 pods and then deleting 120 rcs. Does that sound correct to take 6mins?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +360,364 @@	defer close(stopCh)

	const collections = 10
	var wg sync.WaitGroup
	wg.Add(collections * 4)

comments.body:
Maybe you can add some collections that want orphaning into the stress test?

Also, maybe add some objects that have multiple owners.
ok, I made it through everything except for this test file. hopefully that's enough to keep you busy.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +155,159 @@	gc, clientSet := setup(t)
	oldEnableGarbageCollector := registry.EnableGarbageCollector
	registry.EnableGarbageCollector = true
	defer func() { registry.EnableGarbageCollector = oldEnableGarbageCollector }()
	rcClient := clientSet.Core().ReplicationControllers(framework.TestNS)

comments.body: This sounds like it would be a breaking change in behavior. Why is it necessary? I would expect the actual condition you should wait for is the one that everyone currently uses, that the controller has made all of the pods and is at the correct generation...
Add all varieties of pods which you _don't_ want the GC to delete and verify that it doesn't delete them.
Maybe this is an easier place to add the multi-thread test.
